intro: Cracca oligophylla, commonly known as the slender cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
